metadata.title: CSS Computer Science - Complete Subjective Questions Bank
metadata.description: ALL subjective questions from CSS Computer Science papers (2016-2025) with detailed solutions

questions.question: (a) Temperature conversion program F↔C. (b) Computer type for individuals. (c) Student Registration System OOP design.
(a) monthly_profit function. (b) Volatile vs Non-volatile memory. (c) Library System classes.
(a) Person structure with age categorization. (b) Binary conversions. (c) Medical Store classes.
(a) Tree terminology. (b) Binary Search complexity. (c) Max-Heap and Heap-sort.
questions.answer:
**Part (a):** Sibling=same parent, Degree=max children, Leaf=no children, Height=longest path, Binary Tree=max 2 children

**Part (b):** T(n)=4+T(n/2) → O(log n)

**Part (c):** Array {8,14,2,26,10,12,16,28,20,7}
Max-Heap: [28,26,16,20,10,12,2,14,8,7]
Heap-sort: Extract max repeatedly → sorted

questions.question: (a) Stack and Queue ADT. (b) Breakeven point analysis. (c) AVL tree construction.
questions.answer:
**Part (a):**
Stack: Push, Pop, Peek (LIFO)
Queue: Enqueue, Dequeue, Front (FIFO)

**Part (b):** n²+10 vs 2^n/4 → Breakeven at n=9

**Part (c):** AVL maintains |balance|≤1 using rotations (LL, RR, LR, RL)

questions.question: (a) C++ compilation process. (b) Compiler vs Interpreter vs Assembler. (c) Waterfall SDLC. (d) SRS vs Design Document.
questions.answer:
**Part (a):** Source→Preprocessor→Compiler→Assembler→Linker→Executable

**Part (b):** Compiler=full program, Interpreter=line-by-line, Assembler=assembly→machine

**Part (c):** Requirements→Design→Implementation→Testing→Deployment→Maintenance

**Part (d):** SRS=WHAT (requirements), Design=HOW (architecture)

questions.question: (a) DFD and ER diagrams. (b) Language properties. (c) Regex to FA.
questions.answer:
**Part (a):** DFD=data flow, ER=database structure

**Part (b):** Alphabet, Syntax, Semantics, Pragmatics, Phonology

**Part (c):** (A|...|Z)*(0|...|9)* → Letters then digits, FA with 3 states

questions.question: (a) 1NF, 2NF, 3NF, BCNF. (b) Functional dependencies.
questions.answer:
**1NF:** Atomic values, no repeating groups
**2NF:** No partial dependencies
**3NF:** No transitive dependencies  
**BCNF:** Every determinant is candidate key

FD: X→Y means X determines Y

questions.question: (a) SQL joins and aggregates. (b) Relational algebra operations.
(a) FCFS, SJF, Round Robin. (b) Waiting and turnaround time.
questions.answer:
**FCFS:** First come first served
**SJF:** Shortest job first (optimal avg wait)
**Round Robin:** Time quantum, preemptive

Example P1(24),P2(3),P3(3) FCFS: Avg wait=(0+24+27)/3=17

questions.question: (a) Paging vs Segmentation. (b) Virtual memory. (c) Page replacement.
questions.answer:
**Paging:** Fixed blocks, no external fragmentation
**Segmentation:** Variable size, logical divisions

**Virtual Memory:** Disk as extended RAM, demand paging

**Page Replacement:** FIFO, LRU, Optimal

questions.question: (a) 7 OSI layers. (b) TCP vs UDP.
questions.answer:
**OSI:** Physical→DataLink→Network→Transport→Session→Presentation→Application

**TCP vs UDP:**
| TCP | UDP |
|-----|-----|
| Reliable | Unreliable |
| Connection-oriented | Connectionless |
| Slower | Faster |

questions.question: (a) Symmetric vs Asymmetric encryption. (b) Digital signatures. (c) Firewalls.
questions.answer:
**Symmetric:** Same key (AES, DES) - faster
**Asymmetric:** Public/private pair (RSA) - secure

**Digital Signature:** Hash→encrypt with private key→verify with public

**Firewall:** Packet filtering, stateful inspection

questions.question: (a) Black-box vs White-box. (b) Testing levels. (c) Test case design.
questions.answer:
**Black-box:** Test without code knowledge
**White-box:** Test with code knowledge

**Levels:** Unit→Integration→System→Acceptance

**Design:** Equivalence partitioning, boundary value analysis

questions.question: (a) Inheritance types. (b) Polymorphism. (c) Abstract classes.
questions.answer:
**Inheritance:** Single, Multiple, Multilevel, Hierarchical

**Polymorphism:**
```cpp
class Shape { virtual void draw()=0; };
class Circle : public Shape { void draw(){} };
```

**Abstract:** Has pure virtual functions, cannot instantiate

questions.question: (a) Pointer arithmetic. (b) Dynamic memory. (c) Memory leaks.
questions.answer:
**Pointers:**
```cpp
int arr[5], *p=arr;
p++; // Points to arr[1]
```

**Dynamic:** new/delete, new[]/delete[]

**Leaks:** Unreleased memory. Use smart pointers.

questions.question: (a) File streams. (b) Binary vs Text. (c) Random access.
questions.answer:
**Streams:** ifstream(read), ofstream(write), fstream(both)

**Binary:** Raw bytes, faster
**Text:** Human-readable, newline conversion

**Random Access:** seekg(), seekp(), tellg()

questions.question: (a) Graph representations. (b) Dijkstra's algorithm. (c) BFS vs DFS.
questions.answer:
**Representations:** Adjacency Matrix O(V²), List O(V+E)

**Dijkstra:** Greedy shortest path O(V² or E log V)

**BFS:** Queue, level-order
**DFS:** Stack, depth-first

questions.question: (a) Hash functions. (b) Collision resolution. (c) Load factor.
questions.answer:
**Hash:** Maps key to index, should be uniform

**Collision:** Chaining (linked lists), Open addressing (probing)

**Load Factor:** α=n/m, keep <0.7

questions.question: (a) QuickSort. (b) MergeSort. (c) Comparison.
questions.answer:
**QuickSort:** Partition around pivot, O(n log n) avg, O(n²) worst

**MergeSort:** Divide, sort, merge, O(n log n) always, stable

| | Quick | Merge |
|--|-------|-------|
| Avg | O(n log n) | O(n log n) |
| Space | O(log n) | O(n) |
| Stable | No | Yes |

questions.question: (a) Compiler phases. (b) Symbol table. (c) Lexical analysis.
questions.answer:
**Phases:** Lexical→Syntax→Semantic→IR→Optimization→CodeGen

**Symbol Table:** Stores identifiers, types, scopes

**Lexical:** Source→Tokens using regex/DFA

questions.question: (a) ACID properties. (b) Concurrency control. (c) Deadlock.
questions.answer:
**ACID:** Atomicity, Consistency, Isolation, Durability

**Concurrency:** 2PL locking, timestamp ordering

**Deadlock:** Prevention, detection (wait-for graph), recovery

questions.question: (a) Primary vs Secondary index. (b) B-Tree. (c) B+ Tree.
questions.answer:
**Primary:** On ordering key
**Secondary:** On non-ordering field

**B-Tree:** Balanced, O(log n)
**B+ Tree:** All data in leaves, linked for range queries

questions.question: (a) Critical section. (b) Semaphores. (c) Producer-Consumer.
(a) Allocation methods. (b) Directory structures. (c) Free space.
questions.answer:
**Allocation:** Contiguous, Linked, Indexed

**Directory:** Single-level, Two-level, Tree

**Free Space:** Bit vector, linked list

questions.question: (a) IPv4 classes. (b) Subnetting. (c) IPv4 vs IPv6.
questions.answer:
**Classes:** A(/8), B(/16), C(/24)

**Subnetting:** /26 = 64 addresses, 62 usable

**IPv4:** 32-bit, 4.3B addresses
**IPv6:** 128-bit, 340 undecillion

questions.question: (a) Distance vector vs Link state. (b) OSPF. (c) BGP.
questions.answer:
**Distance Vector:** Share tables (RIP), Bellman-Ford
**Link State:** Flood topology (OSPF), Dijkstra

**OSPF:** Interior, hierarchical
**BGP:** Exterior, policy-based

questions.question: (a) Creational patterns. (b) Structural patterns. (c) Behavioral patterns.
questions.answer:
**Creational:** Singleton, Factory, Builder
**Structural:** Adapter, Decorator, Facade
**Behavioral:** Observer, Strategy, Command

questions.question: (a) Try-catch-throw. (b) Exception hierarchy. (c) Custom exceptions.
(a) Function templates. (b) Class templates. (c) Specialization.
(a) Vector, List, Deque. (b) Map, Set. (c) Iterators.
questions.answer:
**Containers:**
| | Vector | List | Deque |
|-|--------|------|-------|
| Access | O(1) | O(n) | O(1) |

**Map/Set:** Red-black tree, O(log n)

**Iterators:** begin(), end(), ++, *

questions.question: (a) Properties. (b) Insertion. (c) vs AVL.
questions.answer:
**Properties:** Root black, red has black children, equal black-height

**Insertion:** Insert red, fix with rotations/recoloring

**vs AVL:** RB=less strict, faster insert; AVL=faster lookup

questions.question: (a) DP principles. (b) Fibonacci. (c) Knapsack.
(a) Greedy approach. (b) Activity Selection. (c) Huffman Coding.
questions.answer:
**Greedy:** Local optimal → global optimal (hopefully)

**Activity Selection:** Sort by finish time, select non-overlapping

**Huffman:** Build tree from frequencies, optimal prefix codes

questions.question: (a) Context-free grammars. (b) Parse trees. (c) Ambiguity.
questions.answer:
**CFG:** G=(V,T,P,S) - variables, terminals, productions, start

**Parse Tree:** Root=start, leaves=terminals

**Ambiguity:** Multiple parse trees for same string

questions.question: (a) Query processing. (b) Equivalence rules. (c) Cost estimation.
questions.answer:
**Processing:** Parse→Optimize→Evaluate

**Rules:** Push selection, commutativity, associativity

**Cost:** Based on disk I/O, table size, indexes

questions.question: (a) Fragmentation. (b) Distributed queries. (c) Two-phase commit.
questions.answer:
**Fragmentation:** Horizontal (rows), Vertical (columns), Mixed

**Queries:** Decomposition, localization, optimization

**2PC:** Prepare→Commit/Abort, handles failures

questions.question: (a) Process vs Thread. (b) Multithreading models. (c) Synchronization.
questions.answer:
| Process | Thread |
|---------|--------|
| Heavy | Light |
| Separate memory | Shared memory |

**Models:** Many-to-one, One-to-one, Many-to-many

**Sync:** Mutex, semaphores, monitors

questions.question: (a) FCFS, SSTF, SCAN. (b) Seek time. (c) Comparison.
questions.answer:
**FCFS:** Service in order
**SSTF:** Nearest first, may starve
**SCAN:** Elevator - one direction, reverse at end

SCAN provides best average seek time and fairness

questions.question: (a) TCP handshake. (b) Flow/Congestion control. (c) UDP uses.
questions.answer:
**3-Way Handshake:** SYN→SYN-ACK→ACK

**Flow Control:** Sliding window
**Congestion:** Slow start, AIMD

**UDP:** DNS, DHCP, VoIP, gaming

questions.question: (a) DES, AES. (b) RSA. (c) Hash functions.
questions.answer:
**DES:** 56-bit, deprecated
**AES:** 128/192/256-bit, current standard

**RSA:** n=pq, φ(n), e, d=e⁻¹ mod φ(n)

**Hash:** MD5 (broken), SHA-256 (secure)

questions.question: (a) Agile principles. (b) Scrum. (c) Kanban vs Scrum.
questions.answer:
**Agile:** Working software, customer collaboration, respond to change

**Scrum:** Sprints, Daily standup, PO, SM, Team

**Kanban:** Continuous flow, WIP limits
**Scrum:** Sprints, commitments

questions.question: Questions on Operator Overloading: +,-,* operators, friend functions, conversion
questions.answer:
**Operator Overloading:**
+,-,* operators, friend functions, conversion

Detailed solutions cover theoretical concepts, practical implementations, and real-world applications of operator overloading.
